## Q4

Assuming: $ Y_i|\gamma_i \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu,\sigma^2/\gamma_i)$
https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~jordan/courses/260-spring10/lectures/lecture5.pdf

$$
\begin{align}
\int_0^\infty \frac{\sqrt{\gamma}}{\sqrt{2\pi}\cdot(\sigma)}\exp{\left(-\frac{1}{2}\frac{\gamma(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right)} 
\times \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)}\gamma^{\alpha-1}\exp{(-\gamma\beta)}\\

= \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \int_0^\infty \sqrt{\gamma}\exp{\left(-\frac{1}{2}\frac{\gamma(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right)}
\times\gamma^{\alpha-1}\exp{(-\gamma\beta)} \\

= \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \int_0^\infty \gamma^{(\alpha+\frac{1}{2})-1}\exp{\left(-\gamma\beta-\frac{1}{2}\frac{\gamma(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right)}
 \\
 
 = \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \int_0^\infty \gamma^{(\alpha+\frac{1}{2})-1}\exp{\left(-\gamma \left(\beta+\frac{1}{2}\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right)\right)}
 \\
 
 = \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \int_0^\infty \gamma^{\hat{\alpha}-1}\exp{\left(-\gamma \hat{\beta}\right)}, \hspace{0.5cm}\hat{\beta}=\left(\beta+\frac{1}{2}\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right), \hat{\alpha}=\alpha+1/2\\
 
= \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \frac{\Gamma(\hat{\alpha})}{\hat{\beta}^{\hat{\alpha}}}\\
 
 
= \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2\pi)}\sigma} \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\Gamma(\alpha)} \frac{\Gamma(\alpha+1/2)}{\left(\beta+\frac{1}{2}\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{\sigma^2}\right)^{\alpha+1/2}}\\
 
\end{align}
$$

$$ 
\begin{align}
\frac{1}{\sigma}\frac{\Gamma(\phi+1/2)}{\sqrt{2\pi}\Gamma(\phi)}\phi^\phi
\left(\phi+\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right)^{-\phi-1/2}\\

\frac{1}{\sigma}\frac{\Gamma(\phi+1/2)}{\sqrt{2\pi}\Gamma(\phi)}\phi^\phi
\left(1+\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2\phi}\right)^{-\phi-1/2}\cdot \left(\frac{1}{\phi}\right)^{-\phi-1/2}\\


\frac{1}{\sigma}\frac{\Gamma(\phi+1/2)}{\sqrt{2\pi}\Gamma(\phi)}
\left(1+\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2\phi}\right)^{-\phi-1/2}\cdot \left(\frac{1}{\phi}\right)^{-1/2}\\

\frac{1}{\sigma}\frac{\Gamma(\phi+1/2)}{\sqrt{2\pi \phi}\Gamma(\phi)}
\left(1+\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2\phi}\right)^{-\phi-1/2}\\

\end{align}
$$
